title: Desem Honors Citi Uruguay for 20 Years of Collaboration
summary: Citi Uruguay, which has had an uninterrupted presence in the country for more than 97 years, received an award from Desem Jóvenes Emprendedores for its two decades of support for the organization.
tag-1: Desem Honors Citi Uruguay for 20 Years of Collaboration
tag-2: Citi Uruguay, which has had an uninterrupted presence in the country for more than 97 years, received an award from Desem Jóvenes Emprendedores for its two decades of support for the organization.
tag-3: Citi Uruguay is a founding partner of Desem. Its involvement with the organization dates back to 1993, when the two institutions teamed up to pursue a common goal: to promote the values of excellence, honesty and persistence among young people.
tag-4: Daniel Varese, General Manager of Citi Uruguay and a member of the board of Desem, accepted the distinction on behalf of the bank at an April 30 event at the Uruguay Golf Club in Montevideo.
tag-5: "Young people are without doubt the pillar and future of our society, and it is therefore essential that we offer them the tools they need to face that future with the right training and an entrepreneurial attitude," Varese explained.
tag-6: The vision of Desem Jóvenes Emprendedores is "to be a catalyst for change in Uruguayan society by helping children and young people develop an entrepreneurial spirit and the capacity to achieve their goals." The organization sponsors a range of educational programs for students from elementary school through college.
tag-7: "The foundation couldn't do its work without the help of our partners, who contribute their vision in different ways," noted Paola Rapetti, Executive Director of Desem Jóvenes Emprendedores. "We are grateful for the support of all of the companies that remain committed to us year after year."
tag-8: Desem programs currently reach more than 16,000 children and young people every year in all 19 of the country's provinces. It is the local representative of Junior Achievement Worldwide (JAW), an organization Citi supports at the global level and, locally, through two programs: Empresas Juveniles (Youth-Run Companies) and Carreras para el Éxito (Careers for Success), an exclusive Citi initiative designed specifically for the needs of young people in Uruguay. Citi also contributes to the organization's efforts through employee volunteer programs and donations of cash and materials essential for carrying out Desem projects.
tag-9: Also present at the April 30 event honoring Citi was Claudio Paolillo, director of the weekly magazine Búsqueda, who shared his perspective on entrepreneurism in Uruguay and acknowledged the work that Citi Uruguay and other companies do to support Desem and make possible its activities.
tag-10: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-12: DESEM Jóvenes Emprendedores DESEM Jóvenes Emprendedores is a non-profit organization founded in Uruguay in 1991 as the local representative of Junior Achievement Worldwide. The foundation's vision is "to be a catalyst for change in Uruguayan society by helping children and young people develop an entrepreneurial spirit and the capacity to achieve their goals." It accomplishes this objective by implementing hands-on educational programs designed to provide children and young people with important entrepreneurial skills.
